_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Blakeney GU #1H & #2H PRODUCTION FACILITY RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
Presco, Inc. (Presco) has a long-standing commitment to workers and public safety.
This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention such as training
personnel and considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the facilities
processes. The Presco policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of
substances.

DESCRIPTION OF THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES
Presco operates the Blakeney GU #1H & #2H Production Facility in Madison County, Texas. This facility is a natural gas processing plant which removes liquids from a gas stream. Mixed liquids removed from the gas stream are stored in a pressurized bullet tank prior to being shipped off site in tanker trucks. As evidenced in the ensuing text, the Blakeney GU #1H & #2H Production Facility is a Program 1 process.

The Blakeney GU #1H & #2H Production Facility was evaluated to determine if any regulated flammable or toxic substances were present in the process and if they exceeded threshold quantity. All equipment and vessels are considered to be connected and/or co-located; consequently, for purposes of RMP evaluation, all equipment and vessels are part of a single process. The identification of even a single vessel exceeding threshold quantity of a regulated flammable or toxic substance would subject a process to threshold determination for offsite consequence analysis.

Presco identified one flammable liquid mixture and zero regulated toxic substances. The identification of this exceedance indicates that the Blakeney GU #1H & #2H Production Facility is a covered process with a regulated substance subject to offsite consequence analysis.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
The Blakeney GU #1H & #2H Production Facility has not had any accidental releases that meet

the criteria for an accidental release as discussed in 40 CFR 68.42.

LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE COORDINATION
Since the facility is unmanned, Presco will not implement a site-specific emergency response plan.
Emergency response activities are coordinated with the LEPC who will contact the local fire department as required in 40 CFR 68.12(b)(3).
